# Pull Request Template

## PR Description

Provide a concise summary of the changes in this Pull Request. What problem does it solve? What new feature does it introduce?

--- 

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring / Code Cleanup
- [ ] Performance Improvement
- [ ] Testing

--- 

## Checklist

*   [ ] I have read and followed the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/chirag127/SynthCode-AI-Code-Assistant-VSCode-Extension/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines.
*   [ ] My code passes all automated tests and linters.
*   [ ] I have updated the documentation where necessary.
*   [ ] My changes introduce no breaking changes or I have clearly documented them.
*   [ ] I have ensured all dynamic links and references use the repository name `SynthCode-AI-Code-Assistant-VSCode-Extension`.

---

## Notes for the Reviewer

Add any specific instructions or context for the reviewer here. For example, areas that require extra attention or specific test cases to run.

--- 

## AI Agent Directives Verification

This PR has been reviewed against the AI Agent Directives as defined in [AGENTS.md](https://github.com/chirag127/SynthCode-AI-Code-Assistant-VSCode-Extension/blob/main/AGENTS.md) to ensure alignment with the project's architectural and development standards. The following verification steps have been considered:

*   **Code Quality:** Adherence to TypeScript strictness, Vite/Biome/Vitest configurations.
*   **Architecture:** Compliance with Feature-Sliced Design principles for extensions.
*   **Testing:** Coverage of unit tests (Vitest) and end-to-end tests (Playwright).
*   **Performance:** Optimization for VS Code extension responsiveness.

If any directives were violated, please address them in this PR.
